Headline: Indonesia reports highest daily Covid-19 spike since late January | The Star
Text:
Thursday, 17 Jun 2021
                Health workers collect swab samples from shoppers to test for the Covid-19 coronavirus before they are allowed to enter a shopping mall in Surabaya on June 17, 2021. - AFPJAKARTA (Xinhua): Indonesia on Thursday (June 17) recorded 12, 624 newly-confirmed cases of Covid-19 in the past 24 hours, marking the highest daily spike since Jan 30 and bringing the total tally to 1, 950, 276, the Health Ministry said.The Covid-19 related death toll added by 277 to 53, 753, the ministry reported.Additional 7, 350 recovered patients were discharged from hospitals, bringing the total number of recoveries from the pandemic in the Southeast Asian country to 1, 771, 220.The coronavirus has spread to all the country's 34 provinces.Specifically, in the past 24 hours, Jakarta recorded 4, 144 newly-confirmed cases, West Java 2, 800, Central Java 1, 752, East Java 722 and Yogyakarta 595.No new cases were detected in Gorontalo province.
